reviews.review_msg: Lectures are dry and it is hard to get help outside of lecture as you have to book office hours. Not much practice assingments given, and the assignments that are for grades often have many mistakes in them.
Super nice, patient person and good professor. She knows how to dissect an abstract context into smth we students can understand. Highly recommend
Best prof

Just finished her final. I am saying all questions are not related with her lectures and previous quizzes. Thank you prof, you are such a nice professor to enlighten students with nonsense and hilarity. Your final exam ruins my desire to apply for econometrics for my graduate school. Thanks.

Super easy course materials and there is no formula to derive the question type. As a mandatory course for econ, this is the simplest course ever. As a considerate professor, she can often drive the classroom atmosphere and patiently answer any questions for students. highly recommended!

She is the kindest professor I have ever experienced. She speaks slowly, so you can understand anything you want to know. This course has only one mid-term exam and it is very simple. Although I have not yet passed the final exam, I am confident that I can get an A+. She is the best professor I have ever met!

Basically, you will not get any examples to prepare in her class. It takes her a bit long to explain concepts, yet cannot be explained clearly. High curve. For me personally, it is frustrating that reminds me of my high school math. Never reply to my email, and weekly quiz is based on her own creation and takes 30% of the grade. Good Luck.

Take her course and get ready to frustrate yourself. Impatient and never reply to your message respectively to the way I was. One quiz per week, EZ but stressful. The curve is hilarious, numerous ghostwriters.

Vasyl is a fun professor and explains concepts very clearly. He does not use slides, but writes everything out during lectures, which actually helps with understanding. I feel very lucky to have had him for ECON 333.
Don't do it. He is never present. Prof doesn't respond to emails. He doesn't really teach and its just ridiculous.

This class is brutal online. Super disorganized. Prof doesnt respond to emails, TA's don't really know what's going on. You'll think you did everything right and somehow the average is 50%. The lectures are useless, nothing is on time. No class examples and overall, you're looking at a C before you get started.

I took 2 online classes with him at the same time. Give you no chance to improve your grade since 5-6 assignments decide 50% the weight of your grade! Doesn't reply email, doesn't post assignment key on time, doesn't make any effort to prevent cheating. He is cool, but annoying as a prof. If you're hesitating, DO NOT take him please.

Bertille is an amazing prof! I was scared of this class since I did really poorly in BUEC 232. But her lectures go through the material so well, and her live sessions were great! She answered every question in the chat. It's definitely not an easy class and you have to work for it. But do not slack off because weekly quizzes are worth a lot!

I learned a majority of the content from the textbook since I found her explanations mediocre at best. I only went to lectures for the R portion. The content of her exams isn't difficult but the time constraint makes them the most stressful tests I've ever taken.
Great prof. Lecture can be dry but thats just the material. Best bet is to go to office hours, she's very helpful and relaxed. One of my fav profs at SFU!

Marie is really kind and always ready to help. Her classes and expectation are simple and clear. She really cares whether you understand or not and will always take the extra time to explain concepts to you. One of the best professors at SFU in my opinion.
Lots of silly-talk during lecture. Syllabus was more test heavy then one posted on course description. Average grade was lower then other 333 classes.
The most difficult class I have ever taken, avoid to enrol her class if you can.

Posts Useless drawn out lectures without live component and goes on tangents to show how smart she is. You will need the Ta's to teach you this course. The course turned out to be way more test heavy then syllabus posted on course description. I guess she could be worse though.

Prof Rekkas is knowledgeable, but she's lazy. Always cancels office hours even when you ask her personally, re-uses old tests as practice exams even though we don't do the same material anymore, and doesn't add the material we did do. Her lectures are drawn out in some places, and rushed in others. On the plus side, she does respond to emails quick
She is a knowledgeable scholar alright. Yet she is uncaring and aloof. Grades aside, it is easy to feel depressed due to her icy personality and bad attitude to students.
Great prof

Unfortunately, my group and I understood nothing and had to take extra effort it all by ourselves. So unless you're a self-learner, try to take it with Thomas Vigie, because he cares about what he teaches and is easily accessible, whereas this prof tries to look like he is busy. I just asked myself, why did SFU even hire him.
